intro: Matelea hirtelliflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with showy flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central corolla. Matelea hirtelliflora is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils along streambanks and canyons.
